inn1.comm: poor start there, outside off stump, swinging away further too wide for the umpire
better ball this time, shaping away, Amla drives crisply to cover
good delivery, definite away movement, Amla leaves alone
this time Amla plays, but with treats the ball suspiciously, prodding carefully into the off side
lovely shot this time, Amla steps back and punches a back-foot drive powerfully away for four
four more! On the front foot this time, playing late and crisply punching a drive through cover
having taken two boundaries he's content to leave alone
good start, touch of movement into Smith who gets into a typically square position and brings his broad bat down in defence
swinging away this time, Smith looks at it before shouldering arms in disgust
Masakadza gets his line slightly wrong, feeding leg-stump and Smith tickles it round the corner
wow, Amla almost played an ugly shot here, normally so stylish, this time he mis-timed a slap into the leg side for a couple
Amla is rocketing along but if you're going to bowl anywhere to him, full and wide is the worst you'd think, he smashes this through point to beat a diving third man
touch of extra bounce for Masakadza and Amla defends
oh dear, Mpofu hasn't started well here, this is wide outside off stump and begging for Smith to do the obvious - clatter a boundary square of the wicket
better here, straighter, a touch shorter and Smith blocks
on the pads but Smith picks out midwicket with his leg-side nurdle
this time it's well outside off and Smith leaves alone
Mpofu is playing a dangerous game feeding the cut shot, Smith crashes towards cover where a diving stop prevents damage
tighter line this time, much better, Smith blocks
well, Mpofu dishes up another outside off and this time Smith cracks it for four. The pitch looks very good for batting and the Zimbabwe opening bowlers look similar
good line and length here, heading towards the top of off and Amla can only defend
oops, Masakadza follows a good ball with a leg-stump half-volley that Amla flicks through midwicket for four
goodness me, Amla timed that very well indeed, it rocketed to mid-off

slightly shorter and Amla works it off his hip to Grant Flower at square leg, Flower is sporting a thick carpet of hair, which I'm sure he didn't have a few years ago. Probably getting tips from Goochy at Essex
lovely shot, this wasn't even that bad a ball, just back of a length, Amla got deep into his crease and punched a boundary in front of point
Amla opens the face and guides to third man for a single to steal the strike
wild cricket here, swing for the bowler and a big swing from Amla - the delivery was wide and the shot missed
inside-edge this time! Amla flashing outside off and the ball squirts behind square on the leg side
bit of extra pace and bounce from the bowler and a careless fence outside off from Smith
nothing careless about this shot, Smith had everything in it's right place and drove sweetly to deep cover
some extra bounce again, judging from his expression Amla is surprised by the bounce, but he drives to mid-off
excellent delivery, Mpofu needs to hold this line, honing in at the top of off
this is a seriously good shot, wasn't a poor ball but Amla offered a full-face punch and it raced past mid-off. His grace threatens to annihilate the attack
good first delivery from Masakadza, Smith watches carefully and defends
again a good length and line and again Smith can only defend
good sign for Smith here, driving powerfully down the ground where only a sprawling stop at mid-off prevents a boundary
this is turning into an excellent over, touch of pace and bounce and Amla defends
excellent cricket here, Amla wanders down the wicket and Masakadza responds by shoving in a quick bouncer, Amla jerks his head and bat out the way
good finish to an excellent over, the best of the day, slower ball is calmly defended
short and a touch of width here but Smith picks out point with his cut shot
heave-ho! What an ugly swipe, Smith swings across the line, gets a top edge that goes airily down to third man
it's spreading! Amla this time mows across the line without any timing, finding midwicket
that's more like it, Amla up on his toes and flicking away with great style into the leg side
misfield at midwicket gives Smith runs, clubbing a short ball into the leg side
oh dear that's very wide and very shot and brings up the South Africa 50
what a shot this is, Amla gets a length ball and punches it, at the top of its bounce, over mid-off to the boundary
Smith runs down the wicket this time and bunts this over the midwicket region to the boundary
good comeback delivery, quicker and Smith is hurried and inside-edges via the pad into the off side
dished up full outside off stump and Amla murders it through point, the bat came down in a flash
this time Amla stands tall and guides down to third man for a single, he looks in complete control
gone! Where did that come from!? Length ball on and around off stump, Smith opened his body to aim a booming drive but picked out Brendan Taylor at short cover and Zimbabwe strike!
ooh, almost gone first ball, shortish delivery down the leg side, Ingram tried to flick it away but got nothing on it, appeal from the bowler and keeper but the umpire is thoroughly disinterested
not a great delivery first up, angled down the leg side, Amla flicks away easily for four
much better this time and Amla can only find a single
good delivery, round the wicket to the left-hander, banging it in on a decent line and length and Ingram defends
back of a length again, just outside off and Ingram lets it go by
tighter line this time, Ingram stands tall, and he's a tall man indeed, and drops into the leg side
similar ball, similar shot but enough on it for Ingram to collect a single
Ingram looks like he's wants to bed himself in here, watching everything carefully and defending
this is a tidy shot, worked neatly into the square-leg region for a single
slower ball that Amla waits for patiently before deflecting into the leg side for another single
that will give Ingram some confidence, gets a full ball first up and nails a straight drive down the ground for four
slightly shorter from the bowler this time, Ingram gets back and punches to cover crisply
worked off the hip for a single down to fine leg
starts with a wide down the leg side
better delivery this time, on and around off stump and defended
not ideal this, slipped down the leg side once again and Ingram collects a couple towards deep square
Chigumbura drops this short and Ingram stands tall guide to third man
Amla probably does, he opens the face here to pick up a couple to third man
lovely shot to bring up his 50 from 32 balls, punching a back-foot drive through point for four
better ball to finish the over, much straighter and Amla drives back to the bowler
overpitched to begin the over, crisply driven down back to the bowler
Masakadza  corrects his length, but the line is far enough outside off to allow Ingram to open-face guide to third man
clipped into the leg side neatly by Amla, he looks in fine, fine touch
Ingram stands tall to defend a shortish ball
wonderful fielding from Hamilton Masakadza at gully, diving to stop a lashing cut shot
team Masakadza to the fore again with Hamilton fielding at point to end a good over
Chigumbura lucky to get away with this, feeding Amla a cut shot square of the wicket that finds point
not a great delivery here, Chigumbura getting his line all wrong, miles outside off and Amla flashes it away for four
follows up a boundary by dropping behind square on the off side for one
better delivery that Ingram defends into the off side
Chigumbura slides this down the leg side and it's worked away for a single
single to end the over, Amla slashing a length ball to the sweeper at deep cover
good start from the new bowler, on and around and length, worked to square leg for a single
touch shorter this time and punched to mid-off
this time Ingram works to square leg and scampers through for one
decent delivery, just outside off stump, not much spin yet and Amla drives to deep cover
strangled shot from the bowler as Ingram defends with bat and pad
worked down the ground for a single to bring up South Africa's 100
poor delivery, shoved well down the leg side for a wide
slightly straighter, but still aimed too far down the leg side and gifting a single to fine leg
this is a touch better and pushed into space
this again is down the leg side for another wide
good work from the bowler, straighter and Ingram can only defend
Ingram in no hurry here, happy to watch carefully and block
picked off into the square-leg region
Amla opens the face and collects a single to third man
Amla defends into the off side
nicely played, turns his wrists over the ball to send it into a gap at midwicket
touch too short this time, no air on the ball whatsoever, Ingram gets back in a flash and cutting firmly past cover for four
much better delivery, slower, fuller and Ingram can only defend
ooh! Big shout as Ingram aims a big sweep, looked to be hit in front but the umpire decides against it
no alarms for Amla, picks out a gap and takes a single
ooh, good ball first up, some spin and bounce and Amla defends very tetchily
Amla advances down the wicket but is beaten in the flight a touch and can only defend
lovely delivery here, Amla watches carefully as it dips and spins sharply into his defence
chipped a touch insecurely down the ground to bring up the 50 partnership
line a fraction wrong to the left-hander and Ingram works it with the spin into the leg side for one
a bit short and allows Amla to get deep into his crease to pull a single to fine leg but an excellent first over from Cremer
much flatter from Utseya and Amla can't time his cut shot
this is worked into the legs side
Ingram drives very straight and it deflects off the non-striker to long-off for one
milked for a single down the ground
touch too short, Ingram deep into his crease cutting powerfully to deep point
bit of a leading edge here from Amla but no alarm, it just goes out to long-off four a single
Cremer continues and Amla picks out short midwicket with a leg-side clip
definite turn for Cremer and Amla drives to deep point
Ingram drops into the leg side and scampers through for one, Amla was hesitant, but made his ground comfortably
full toss but Amla's drive is intercepted by a sliding mid-off
single taken here, worked into the leg side
Ingram looks a touch uncomfortable on the sweep, he swipes very hard at it with his pad bang in front, no alarms here though as he connects nicely
touch flatter and shorter to start with and cut out to deep point
smart work behind the stumps as Utseya fires this down leg
this time it's pushed into space for a single
Amla stands tall and pushes down the ground for one
Ingram looks a touch stiff against the spinners and his poked drive finds the bowler
single this time, milked down the ground
shouts of "Ã‡atch it" as Ingram flicks the ball towards mid-on
beaten by a delivery that didn't turn in as much as Ingram expected, goes past the outside edge
chopped behind square leg for a single
flighted delivery, Amla charges down the track and drives firmly but back towards the bowler
again Amla uses his feet and drives nicely but this time he can't beat the man at extra cover
Close call for Amla there, a short ball that sat up for him, he mowed it towards deep midwicket, the ball lands just wide of the diving fielder there and runs away for four
shortish and outside leg, swept behind square

very wide outside off stump, Amla rocks back and carves the ball powerfully behind point, fielder races across to try stop that, he gets a hand on it but can't prevent the ball from rolling over the rope
on the pads this time, gently nudged towards square leg for a single
short ball, Ingram was down the track, decides against a big shot, pushes the ball towards cover
just outside off, Amla picks up another single by working the ball to point
Ingram moves away from leg to make room, he slashes the ball towards point but can't beat the fielder there
nicely tossed up, Amla plays an inside-out drive towards sweeper cover
again it is flighted, fullish this time, Ingram whips it towards long-on to bring up the 150
huge shout for lbw, Ingram goes for the sweep but misses and is struck on the front pad, might have hit him just outside off, very close, Zimbabwe  will feel a bit unlucky at that
punched firmly towards cover
nudged towards midwicket for a single
uses his feet to play the ball behind square leg, straight at the fielder
driven to long-on for a couple
played back towards the bowler
Amla backs away from the stump and stabs the ball towards cover
'catch it' shouts the keeper as a leading edge from Ingram which sends the ball towards mid-on
rocks back and cuts to deep point for a single
end of  an unthreatening over, Ingram shouts 'Wait' after slapping the ball to point
all too easy for Amla, guided to sweeper cover for a single
a superb effort from Chibhabha saves Zimbabwe a run, he races across from square leg and dives to cut off a powerful swipe from Ingram that looked headed for a boundary
punched back to the bowler
clipped towards midwicket, straight at the fielder
short ball from Cremer, Amla gets on the backfoot and slams it towards deep midwicket
cut away towards sweeper cover to end the over
length ball heading for off, driven along the ground towards long-on
flighted this time, played with soft hands towards the off side
fullish ball just outside off, eased down to long-on by Ingram again
flatter delivery, heading for middle and leg, Amla moves away from leg and pushes the ball towards cover
again he makes room and plays towards point, this time wide enough of the fielder to get a single
Ingram gets his third single of the over towards long-on, Zimbabwe looking toothless here
defended towards cover by Ingram
worked to square leg for a single
into the pads, Amla looking to play it to the leg side but gets an edge towards cover
more runs to long-on for Ingram, whipped down the ground
some turn for Cremer there, drifts outside leg and turns into the pads, Amla defends
again the ball spins towards the batsman after pitching outside leg, Amla looks to sweep but misses
flat delivery fired into middle and leg, turned towards square leg for a single
tossed up a touch, well outside off, Amla plays it behind backward point for a couple, moves onto 98
spins towards off after pitching on leg, Amla plays with soft hands towards backward point and sprints through for a single
another single for Ingram, nudged towards square leg for a more relaxed run than the previous one
no century yet for Amla, he punches the ball to midwicket
two dots ball means Amla's still on 99 at the end of the over, he made a bit of room to work the ball towards extra cover but couldn't place it well enough to get a run
bounces sharply, Ingram forced onto the backfoot and he defends towards cover
very full this time, swept towards square leg and Ingram moves on to 49
Amla gets to century No. 4, it was a poor delivery from Cremer, way down the leg side and full,Amla helped it past the short fine for a boundary
makes room and plays it uppishly past cover
another South African milestone, Ingram gets to his half-century on debut by sweeping towards square leg
on middle and leg, Amla gets on the backfoot and whips the ball behind square leg for a single
length ball outside off, Amla moves beyond leg and pushes the ball towards extra cover for a single
length ball heading for off, worked towards midwicket for a single
moves onto the backfoot and plays it towards cover
Amla skips beyond leg and turns the ball towards square leg for a single
a hit-me full toss, Ingram accepts the gift, comes down the track and whacks it between long-on and deep midwicket
reverts to his favoured single-to-long-on method
starts by offering some width outside off that is stroked through to deep point for a single
good ball here! Traps Amla hanging on the back foot and there was a big appeal from the bowler, replays show it just about clipping leg stump so the decision is a good one
touch shorter, Amla tries to hit a pull shot too hard and can't connect properly, gets a single for his effort
Ingram on the drive but he doesn't time it well, finding short cover
beaten this time, touch of width, Ingram flashes but some extra bounce clears the top edge
slower ball and this time the cut is more controlled, played out to third man
starts with a gently rolled spinner on around middle that Ingram caresses into the leg side for a single
everything apart from the timing was good about this shot, Amla jumping outside leg and driving inside-out over cover for a couple
wide arrowed down the leg side

oh dear! What's Amla done here!? Given his wicket away, that's what! Knocked to midwicket and he set off for a single that was never there, Utseya got the throw back in time to the bowler, who had Amla out well short of his ground
this is defended carefully off the back foot
once again Ingram defends studiously
touch shorter, Ingram deep into his crease and drives into the off side
wow, dished up invitingly by Mpofu but Ingram's drive is imperious. Clattered through extra cover
follows the boundary by opening the face and guiding a single to third man to bring AB de Villiers, the leading ODI player in the world apparently, on strike
unfussy start from de Villiers, gliding a single to third man
some extra pace and extra bounce here, beats Ingram as he tries to dab an upper-cut away
good delivery here that Ingram can only hop back and defend
full ball and full-face drive to finish the over, down the ground for a single
Ingram slaps a cover drive away for a couple to take the record for the highest ODI score on debut for a South African, beating Shaun Pollock. Well done him
driven again, but this time for a single that breaks no records at all, apart from the one he just set I guess
again no fuss for de Villiers, working it round the corner for a single
pushed down the ground, but no run available
touch too short but the cut shot isn't timed ideally so Ingram can only collect a single
de Villiers was winding up for a big sweep shot here and changed his mind last minute, opting to drive inside-out over cover and played the shot superbly, timing all the way to the boundary
starts a touch too short and Miller knocks a single to deep cover
de Villiers skips down the wicket before prodding rather anti-climatically to cover
down the track again but an equally sedate push down the ground for a single
good ball this, touch quicker and Ingram is hurried for pace and can't time it
pretty quick and flat again but this time Ingram is set up better and pushes for a single
driven crisply to long-off for a single
pushed into a space to make the score a delightful 222 for 2
driven with the minimum of fuss and risk down the ground
touch of spin here, de Villiers defends very studiously
Cremer is just pushing it through a fraction, worried about what de Villiers could do, the batsman is content to work into the leg side for a swiftly run couple
close here, short ball keeps very low and de Villiers bottom-edges between his legs, past the keeper for three
Ingram still doesn't look comfortable sweeping, has no real deftness of touch, but gets it away well enough for a single
nudged to midwicket
touch shorter, Ingram back in a flash and cutting to deep point for a single
lovely shot here, touch of class from de Villiers, fraction short from the bowler and de Villiers waited on the back foot to pick the gap at backward point for a boundary
this time it's defended more carefully
too short again, pulled to deep midwicket
resolute defence from Ingram to end the over
pushed down the ground very quietly for a single
nicely bowled, saw Ingram advancing but Cremer held his nerve, fired it in quicker and it was defended
Ingram on the sweep again, doesn't play it well, top-edging to deep square
very neat work behind the stumps, collects a leg-side wide and has the bails off in a flash
nicely bowled, touch of air, de Villiers advanced but was done in the flight and could only defend
de Villiers steps outside leg to give himself room, but works it away for just a single
good over from Cremer ends with him being carefully driven to long-off
Utseya to bowl it, and he starts well, firing it in quick and flat and it's defended

gone! de Villiers is out run out! Direct hit from Cremer has him short, despite a despairing dive! Ingram knocked it into the midwicket region looking for one but Cremer had the stumps down in a flash
very carefully defended first up to make it three dots in a row
pushed hesitantly into the off side and a single taken
open-faced glide to third man, nothing dramatic from the batsmen this over
brilliant Powerplay over from Utseya, what nerve he's shown! This is fired in quick and flat and defended
oh dear, poor start from Masakadza, full toss on leg stump with fine leg up in the ring, all the batsman has to do is get a touch on it and it's a boundary
now that's much better, yorker on leg stump that Ingram just about jabs a bat down on time. Mind you, if yorkers are the plan, a short fine leg shouldn't be
slower ball on a length, Ingram tries to work it to third man where Williams makes a hash of the fielding inside the ring and allows a couple
oh no! Awful delivery. Gentle leg-stump full toss, about shin height, Ingram bludgeons it over the rope at cow corner
slower ball again and cut to third man for a single

what a catch! Utseya pulls of a blinder! Horrid delivery, dragged down short, Morkel tried to slap it away through cover airily but a diving Utseya got two hands to it at diving to his right at short cover and held on securely
Utseya is doing a fine job here, maintaining length and line and nothing Ingram can do
just a single here, blocked into the leg side
quietly defended first ball
nothing for Miller here, pushing to cover
Miller picks out a single down the ground
excellent shot, we haven't seen this type of sweep from Ingram today, gets down early and dabs it round the corner, using the pace of the quicker ball to collect a boundary
poor delivery, really poor ball, short fine leg is up and this is a short ball outside leg stump, all Miller has to do is get some bat on it and he helps it round the corner to collect a boundary
another short ball, outside leg stump again, Miller whips a pull shot for another boundary
much, much better, full, straight, dot. Difficult to get yorkers away
not quite yorker length but good enough to restrict Miller to a single, knocked to long-on
Ingram almost slashes a full, wide ball to the point boundary but it's kept inside the rope to leave him on 99
Ingram will have to wait as Miller pushes a single down the ground to pinch the strike
good start from Mpofu, full and and straight and Miller's drive finds cover
action replay but this time Miller sets off for one which he only just makes
beaten! Nervy, nervy shot from Ingram, trying to run it down to third man to bring up the hundred but it climbs past the outside edge
hundred for Ingram! Only the sixth to make a century on ODI debut and the first South African! Leaps and punches the air! After a slow start it's come up in good time, off 110 balls
Miller punches down to long-on for a single
more intent from Ingram here, whipping the powerfully down the ground for a couple
good work from Utseya, flat and quick and nothing the batsman can do
Miller uses his feet but the drive picks out cover
this time he collects the single, knocking into the midwicket region
touch shorter, Ingram's powerful cut finds cover
more air on this, Ingram looks to sweep powerfully but it goes straight to the man at short fine leg
full toss but Ingram misses out, the ball thuds off the pads in a flurry of bat and arms
starts with a short ball that is slapped out to deep point
length better here but the line is wrong, down the leg side
drilled down the ground, rather than try and catch it, Taylor jumps out the way and leaves long-on to slide on the boundary and field well
strange shot here as Ingram tries to flap this over the keeper without connecting
Miller pushes into space to collect a single
oh no! Terrible fielding on the long-on boundary! Ingram tried to heave this away for six but didn't time it, went straight to the man on the boundary who spilled it over the ropes
nothing wrong with the timing on this, Miller down the track and drives crisply, perfectly and a long way for six
this time is driven firmly back to the bowler

Cremer taking a pounding here, offers a touch of width straight into Miller's hitting arc, he swings gloriously through the line to send it miles over the bowler's head. So far the umpire's have called for a new ball!
less alarm here for the bowler as it's squeezed out to deep point
Ingram jumps down the wicket and knocks down the ground to bring up the 50-run stand
good finish to the over but the damage had already been done
starts with a widish delivery that is driven hard to point
slightly tired shot this time, Ingram heaving this into the leg side
slower ball but much too wide, Miller decides against playing
another slower ball, driven over cover for a swiftly-run couple
chipped into the leg side, over midwicket for another lung-busting couple
lovely shot, Miller demonstrating some dexterity to go with his power, flicking this behind square on the leg side to beat the fielder sprawling along the boundary rope
excellent shot! This is timed superbly and placed perfectly, the drive beating everyone to reach the extra cover boundary
crash, nothing but a length delivery but Ingram clubbed it to the cow-corner boundary
wow, this is even better, up in the slot again, Ingram clears his front leg and swings this over the ropes behind the bowler
Masakadza locates something approaching a yorker and is rewarded with a drive down the ground that goes for a couple
that's all from Ingram, but what an innings it's been. Magnificent  hundred on debut ends by missing a paddle-sweep and having his leg stump uprooted
Duminy pops his first ball into the off side and scampers a single
driven very studiously down the ground for a strike-stealing single
Miller bunts a full ball down the ground and his bad timing means he can come back for a second
lucky for the batsman here, outside-edging down to third man for a couple more
Miller gives himself some room to try and scythe a cut into the off side, can't quite time it but still collects a single
full toss here, Duminy looks surprised by the generosity of it all so can only punch tamely to deep point
decent death over this, another single taken down the ground
full toss to finish, Duminy clubs down the ground and he's quick enough to pick up a couple
that will help! What a shot that is! Beautiful straight drive, arrow straight to bring up his fifty from 30 balls
good comeback from the bowler, his figures look very odd now. Lands a perfect yorker that squeezes under Miller's bat to end another excellent lower-order innings from him
slower ball outside the off stump, Botha can't do any damage so a valuable and rare dot ball
Botha tries to swing this away but get more height than distance and it loops one-bounce to long-on
another slower ball, Botha gets back and pulls out to deep midwicket for a single
South Africa do indeed reach 350, and go one better for good measure as Duminy crunches this down the ground and scampers two

inn2.comm: swing from the bowler, swing and a miss from the batsman, decent carry through to de Villiers
good delivery again, touch of away movement, Masakadza defends carefully
beaten! Extra pace, extra bounce, touch of away movement, climbs past the outside edge. Good delivery!
around off stump again and this time defended carefully
beaten once more outside off, really top delivery, zipping away from back of a length
maiden over, the first of the match, Morkel finds a good length and line, Masakadza defends. So 352 to win off 49 now...
Taylor is away and Zimbabwe  are away, in good style too. Parnell floats it up looking for some swing and Taylor drove nicely through the covers for four
better delivery this time, on and around a length and defended carefully
once again Parnell locates a good length and line, Taylor blocks
touch of indrift makes Taylor's defence uncertain and earns a cheer from the South African fielders
movement into the right-hander once more, Taylor fiddles it towards square leg
dug in short, no great pace and Masakadza sways out the way. Smith, back in charge, claps his hands
more swing for Morkel and studiously defended
Taylor pushed to cover and set off for one, there was all sorts of confusion as Miller dived to field, eventually Masakadza ran through but if Miller's throw had hit he would have been well short
good shot for a single here, driven crisply to a diving mid-off
Taylor thinks about playing before deciding against it
steered to third man, with a low backlift
nicely played, good positive intent from Masakadza, getting forward and driving crisply through point for four
Taylor is very compact at the crease, low backlift, minimum of movements, steers this to cover
poor delivery, Parnell hasn't looked quite at his best since his return from injury, this was very short and wide and Taylor lifted it over cover for four
ooh, another mix-up, Masakadza called through for a single and had to dive to try and make his ground, luckily for him Duminy's throw missed
Parnell desperately looking for some swing from a full length, but with so much width offered too it's help-yourself time, and Masakadza duly does, driving handsomely for four
tighter line from Parnell and neatly defended
Parnell dishes up width, Masakadza thinks about a cut shot, before deciding against it
neatly done from Taylor, drops it into the off side and scampers off for one
angled down the leg side, thuds off the pads and runs away for a single
nothing on offer here for Masakadza, defending carefully
nudged to square leg where a diving stop saves a single
woah! What a shot that is! Masakadza punches a back-foot drive straight back past the bowler, timing it perfectly for four
four more! Short ball from Morkel, poor delivery, Masakadza swings it away to the square-leg boundary
Langeveldt is the new man and begins with a full and straight ball that Taylor defends
some typical away swing for Langeveldt, defended carefully once more
lovely shot this time, Langeveldt stays onto leg stump and Taylor flicks it beautifully over midwicket for a boundary
good follow-up to the boundary, rising on his toes to drop a shortish ball into the leg side and scamper a single
good ball this time, reared up from a shortish length and clatters the helmet
short again, Masakadza rises and punches a drive towards cover, gets a single for his effort
Morkel finds the right length and line, a touch of away swing and beats Masakadza outside off
shorter length and steered, a touch edgily down to third man
mistimed into the covers
shortish length whipped to leg where midwicket fields
Masakadza skips outside leg stump and Morkel responds by digging it in short, the pull shot counters and after all that it goes for none
driven straight to mid-off, Masakadza starts to run before colliding with a giant "NO!" from his partner
swift delivery raps Taylor on the pads but it was heading down leg
shorter ball, Taylor stands deep in his crease and upper-cuts, with a hint of top edge, for four, good batting
nudged into the leg side and Taylor takes a couple
good batting from Taylor, clear planning, works another single into the midwicket region
short ball and Masakadza on the pull, plays it well, beating square leg to bring up Zimbabwe's fifty! They've started very well here
beaten this time, swinging into the pads and running away for a single
starts steadily enough, on a length and Masakadza whips him to midwicket
fuller length this time, Masakadza tries to flick to leg but misses
back of a length around off stump, Masakadza rises with the bounce and steers to point
typically neat guide to third man for another strike rotation
Masakadza gives himself a touch of room but his scythe picks out cover
lucky for the bowler, aims around leg stumps but Masakadza misses his shot
Langeveldt  finds a perfect length and line, but also a textbook defence
more MCC stuff from Taylor, who gets everything behind a defensive shot

another huge mix-up between the batsmen! Taylor cut nicely but a diving Duminy made an excellent stop, the Zimbabwe pair were dithering in the middle of the pitch before Taylor finally completed the run, luckily for him the throw was wide
less alarm here, worked to leg for a quick single
good running here, clear think, Taylor gives himself room to drop into the off side and scamper off for one
angled down the leg side, thuds off the pads for a single
top fielding from Ingram on the deep square boundary saves three, bouncer from Theron was pulled away powerfully but a one-handed stop halts Masakadza
bosh! Taylor is a waspish presence at the crease, so still until a flash of the arms sends this thundering through point
follows the boundary with a swift single, inside-edging into the leg side
back of a length, finds a touch of extra bounce and Masakadza defends
Masakadza jumps outside off stump and having got the ball he wants, doesn't quite connect with a leg-side fiddle
this time Masakadza does connect, but just for a single to cover
nothing on offer from Masakadza here, defends carefully
touch shorter, Masakadza needs no second invitation to flap into the midwicket region for a couple
this time Masakadza jumps outside leg stump, and goes too far so can't reach it
good ball here, full and straight and Masakadza prods a defence away for one
Taylor looking to pierce the covers but can't quite get through
interesting shot here, Taylor's game is set up to go through the off side but this is a touch too close to him and too short so he flaps a pull to deep square
Taylor does get to go through the off side this time, plays it well, but there is a man on the boundary

Theron strikes and Masakadza has gone! Only just. Masakadza slugged a short wide ball towards deep point where Botha spilled the original chance before holding his nerve to take it at the second attempt
steered away for a single to bring the new man on strike
good ball here, rising from a length and Chibhabha can only defend
this time it's glided down to third man
change of pace to finish the over, slower ball that is played delicately into the off side
full slower ball on off stump to start the over, Taylor pushes with soft hands to cover and sets off for a swift single
back of a length, Chibhabha rises with it, turns into the leg side and jogs one
back of a length once more, straighter this time and Taylor rocks back to defend

ooh, Taylor almost was defeated by the change of pace here, tried to drive a slower ball down the ground but was through the shot too early, sent a skier which narrowly avoided Parnell running back from mid-on
another close call, this time poor running from Taylor, dropping into the leg side, calling one before thinking better of it
single taken this time without any alarm, nudged to deep midwicket
'catch' was the call from the fielders but nobody was getting near that, short and wide, Chibhabha has been in fine form and timed his cut shot superbly
Chibhabha looks a very organised player, defending crisply, but then ruins the show by slipping over. Perhaps there is some dew out there
good work from Theron, finds a decent length and line and defence is of the order
Chibhabha flicks this to deep square, wants two but only finds one
angled effortlessly down to third man, Theron looks decent but not a lot more than that
again more steady work from Theron, but on flat pitches he doesn't really frighten, Chibhabha drives to deep cover and skips off merrily for a couple
starts tidily enough and Taylor fiddles it into the leg side for a single
this time it's driven calmly down the ground
good over so far from Parnell, this is on a length and line and Taylor steers down to third man

Parnell strikes! Really good delivery too, that should give him some confidence! Shortish ball that reared up at Chibhabha, the batsman thought about pulling, then thought about getting out the way but in the end did neither and it brushed the glove on the way through to de Villiers
good start from Williams, gliding a drive through point to pick up a lung-busting couple
good delivery ends an excellent over with Williams defending
worked away immediately down the ground for a couple by Taylor, very nicely played
this time it's a touch shorter and Taylor defends
on the sweep but can't connect
nudged with very soft hands towards deep square and Taylor was off in a hurry, scampering back for the second to bring up a very well made 50
pushed quietly to leg for another single
decent over from Botha, you suspect Imran Tahir, when he qualifies, would add a bit of magic to this attack but Botha is steady
shortish ball from Parnell, decent pace and carry too, Taylor fiddles to deep square and scampers again
don't bowl there! Taylor loves width outside off stump, dispatches it airily through point and it races to the boundary to bring up the Zimbabwe 100
gets a length ball on leg stump, turns to deep midwicket for a single. South Africa were 118-1 at this stage
scream of 'wait!' from Williams as he blocks this to point
dug in short, Williams sways out the way, not wanting to take it on at this stage
gets another short ball, close to a wide as it sails by harmlessly outside off
good from Botha, very accurate and Taylor can only defend
milked down the ground
nudged into the leg side where short  midwicket tumbles to field
defended once more carefully
single this time, stroked off the back foot
that will help Zimbabwe, wide slipped down the leg side
prodded away for one to end the over
pushed to cover for a single, Taylor looks very good here
Williams has to find a way to rotate the strike a little, he's hitting the ball nicely enough but keeps finding fielders
once again he picks out the infield, guiding to point. Pressure building on Williams here
finally gets it away, threading through backward point for a single
Taylor has no trouble picking up a single, pushing gently to mid-on and scampering one
good over from Parnell, he's been much better this spell
pushed into the covers for a single
massive, extended appeal from the buttoned-up Botha, he loves buttons, but the ball was missing leg
good work from Taylor, deflecting this into the leg side and collecting one
Williams gets off strike straight away, stroking down the ground
touch shorter from Botha, Taylor gets back and full-faces down to long-on
plenty of flurry for a single here, Williams aims an awkward looking reverse paddle, finds deep point and jogs a single
starts outside off and is bunted away for a single
swinging down the leg side, clips the pads and runs away for one
touch shorter this time and Williams slaps it, without much timing, down the ground for a couple
the batsman has missed out here, short outside off but Williams misses it
dropped! Smith doesn't drop many and this wasn't all that hard. Williams outside edged low to the point area where Smith was but the chance was put down
this time the cut is played well enough to beat point
another massive appeal from Botha, not sure what for
good delivery here, Williams is really struggling, can't get anything away
the dots building and Williams is under big pressure here
well, you sensed it was coming, Williams skipped down the wicket and aimed a check-drive over cover, but timed it too well and found Theron running in from long-off
but first Taylor must do as Taylor does best, nudging a single
solidly forward and blocking firmly back to the bowler. First job done
Taylor will feel he's missed out here, full down the leg side but the flick was missed
touch shorter and this time Taylor can work a single down to third man, Zimbabwe just need to join a few singles and twos together, they've got a bit stuck
short ball that Flower rises with and pulls firmly to midwicket
ooh, good delivery, zipping back off the wicket and almost squeezing through, rapped Flower on the thigh and Morkel was excited enough to appeal
this time it's defended with a calm authority, remember he's the batting coach for Zimbabwe so he has to show the youngsters how it's done
driven straight out of the textbook to mid-off, Flower skips through for a swift single
nicely bowled, nothing there for Flower
really top bowling from Botha, offering nothing, no pace for Flower to work with
the batsman advances and flicks this away very crisply but straight to short midwicket, pressure building
another dot ball as Flower runs down the wicket and gets in a tangle as he tries to work to leg, almost yorked himself
finally he knocks a single away, relief for flower
excellent over from Botha, real high-class stuff
pushed away for a much-needed single
slower-ball bouncer, Taylor saw it but still couldn't hold back his shot enough
Taylor has just lost his momentum here, not middling them any more, this runs off the inside edge for a single into the leg side
Flower drives crisply but picks out cover
single taken this time, Flower nudges with soft hands towards cover
nicely done, Taylor keeps the strike with an open-faced glide
Taylor off strike straight away with a well-placed nudge towards midwicket, Flower needs to return the favour
close! Flower runs down the wicket and slices via the outside edge towards third man for a couple
that's better, worked behind square on the leg side for one
Taylor picks out mid-on with a leg-side clip but sets off for one anyway, just about made his ground
dropped! Botha almost had his man! I've never seen him drop one before, Flower drilled a return catch at him but it burst through the hands
good over for Zimbabwe, single taken off every ball, but they needed plenty of luck to get there
that's a remarkably swift single for Flower to have managed, diving full length at the striker's end
ooh dear, another very close call, this would have been gone, Flower missed a leg-side fiddle, it came off the pads and he set off for a tough single
Taylor looks a touch weary out there and misses a routine leg-side nurdle
this time it's pushed to point for an easier single
that'll do for Flower, not exactly timed - it came off the inside edge - but a single down the ground is all he needs for a while
shot! What a brilliant shot that is! Deft hands, upper cutting off the face off the bat a length ball straight over the keeper, first boundary in a long time that
defended into the off side for a swift single
Taylor nurdles this around the corner for a single
Flower on the sweep, luckily for him he didn't time it so it went one-bounce to  deep square to bring up the 150
blocked studiously back to the bowler
again Taylor tickles this around the corner, nothing more than a single available, Botha is really enjoying himself out there
good shot this, the first time Flower has really timed the ball, skipping outside leg and driving inside-out towards the cover boundary
full toss is worked into the leg side for a single
good delivery here, no width to work with and it's driven firmly back to the bowler
full and angling into the pads, thuds away past the keeper for a swiftly-run three
slower ball is worked away behind square for another single
all over for Flower. The comeback ends tamely as he chips a leg-stump half-volley straight to Smith at short midwicket
nudged away for a single first up, gliding behind square
on offstump, nudged behind square for a single
well outside off this time, jabbed towards midwicket
watchfully defended towards the off side
Taibu backs away to make room and slaps that that past a diving cover fielder to pick up a boundary, Zimbabwe need a couple of those every over
on middle and leg, whipped towards midwicket, but placement isn't great
two dot balls to end the over after that boundary, this was nearly an action replay of the previous delivery, played to midwicket for no run
starts with a length ball on the pads, rolls towards the leg side
on middle and off, pushed to the off side, Parnell moves quickly across to cut off any thoughts of a single
short of length and angling across, helped along to third man, some confused calling before the batsmen decide to settle for one
short ball, the batsman ducks as soon as he sees it, it was just down the leg side which means Zimbabwe get a free run
length ball well outside off, driven firmly to extra cover
again Parnell loses his line, way down the leg side
short and wide, carved to sweeper cover for a single
full delivery on middle and leg, punched back past the bowler, not great timing but enough to get a single
slanting into the pads, helped to short fine
turned towards midwicket for a single
on the pads, deflected towards backward square
played with soft hands off the back foot towards the off side
length ball on offstump, Taibu gets on one knee and sweeps that powerfully to deep backward square leg
well outside off, Taylor missed out on that, he stabs that straight to cover
length ball on off, driven past a diving short cover but can't beat mid-off
short of length ball angling across the batsman, who dabs it towards third man
on the pads, length ball, Taibu wants to turn it to the leg side but he misses and is struck on the pads
short ball, Taibu helps it from outside off to square leg for a single
swing and a miss, a length ball outside off and Taylor can't connect

big shout for lbw, Taylor had shuffled across to try work that one to the leg side, he missed and was hit in front of middle, but that ball might have pitched outside leg, only reason he could have escaped
tossed up by Botha, worked toward midwicket
Taibu backs away and carves the ball towards deep backward point

that's the end of Taibu, he was trying to up the scoring, charging down the track to try loft Both over long-off, can't clear Amla at the boundary who nearly makes a mess of a simple catch but holds on on his second attempt
watchfully played towards midwicket
plants his foot forward and looks to drive through the line but is beaten
on middle and leg, whipped to long-on for a single which ends Botha's tidy spell
ovepitched outside off, driven towards cover off the front foot
low full toss on middle, Taylor manages to squeeze it out
short of length delivery on middle, Taylor moves across the stumps and nudges the ball towards square leg
tests the new batsman with a bouncer, the captain ducks under
on the pads this time, guided down to fine leg for an easy single, just three off the over so far, the required rate is nudging 12
a dot ball to end the over, Taylor can only block the ball back down the pitch
a yorker outside off, inside-edge onto the boot, the ball dribbles to the off side
back of a length and heading for offstump, defended towards the off side
again it is back of a length, on middle and off, whipped towards midwicket for a single
shortish ball outside off, guided down to third man for a single, the boundaries aren't coming for Zimbabwe
short and a bit wide outside off, Chigumbura looks to pull it but mistimes it towards midwicket
there's a boundary to end the over, a slower delivery, takes the outside edge which evades the keeper and is too fine for Langeveldt at third man
Langeveldt starts with a full delivery on the pads, punched along the ground to long-on
length ball just outside off, punched to mid-on
shortish ball, on middle stump, batsman seemed to spot it a bit late and ducks awkwardly but in time
length ball on middle and leg, worked towards square leg
length ball on offstump, defended to point for a single
ends the over with a bouncer, batsman gets quickly under it
this feels like an energy-drink fuelled shot, inside-edged into the square leg region for a couple
single taken, pushed into space
Chigumbura manages to deflect this away for one
resolute defence from Taylor, doesn't want to give anything away
another upper-cut-poke shot from Taylor, not quite as good as his previous two but he gets a couple to bring up Zimbabwe's 200
almost the hundred, as the inside-edge runs away square on the leg side, but he'll settle for a single and the strike on 99

close shot! Taylor survives! Good decision from the umpire, it passed close to bat, thudded off the thigh pad and looped to the keeper, South Africa were confident but replays show the umpire was right
quick bouncer down the leg side
Taylor picks out midwicket with a well-timed clip
driven towards deep point to bring Taylor back on strike, can he get to the three figures this time...
outside edge! Taylor is having a nervous 99! Tried to run it down to third man but the slower-ball found the edge that bobbled along the ground to the keeper
another slower ball, this time down the leg side and Taylor's wait continues
wide again! Taylor can't get a fiddle on these leg-side deliveries and he's pinned on 99

there it is! Taylor steers past point for a single to bring up a brilliant hundred. Played a lone hand and without flourish has got there in 105 deliveries. No great celebration just the look of a man who has done a tough job well in impossible circumstances. He gets a well-deserved pat on the back from the bowler, which is good to see
Chigumbura defends carefully to end the over
Theron is desperately blowing on his hands trying to find some warmth, it's pretty cold out there, the delivery is good though and Taylor defends
having reached the landmark Taylor has an almighty hack at this, top edging over the keeper and it pitches and dies. Could have had two but one-short signalled by the umpire
bosh! That's what he needs to do, get down on one knee and swing into the leg side for four. Do that four 10 overs and we could have a great finish!
full toss is driven firmly but straight to cover
short and wide, Taylor again has a swipe at it, sending it one-bounce to third man
shortish ball outside off, Chigumbura stands perfectly still and mows, finding nothing but thin air
indeed it does! Boom! Taylor doesn't bother with quaint things like footwork, he just stands still and flicks this with a world of timing through midwicket for four
once again Taylor has had enough of footwork, so aims a flat-footed bunt down the ground, toe-ending for a single
bouncer from the bowler and Chigumbura decides to duck, which given the powerplay, seems a bit of a waste
fuller ball inside-edged into the pads and squirting into the off side for a swift single
high but not very far, Taylor backs away and lifts this over cover, not timing it ideally but still a couple more
better shot this time but the ball is landing and pitching on the outfield, Taylor drives over mid-off for a couple more
Chigumbura has not been able to tee-off at all here, another flurry of bat and arms but to little effect and the ball trickles away for a single
three in a row for Taylor, driving high, high, high without enough distance to collect a couple
deftly played here, steered to short third man for a single
driven without much timing to mid-off to bring up a 50 stand
this time Taylor has timed it perfectly! In the slot from Theron and Taylor laced it through cover to bring up a career best
driven again, much less expansively but for a strike-stealing single
starts with a full toss that Taylor tries to flick into the leg side, only manages to bunt back to the bowler
good yorker, Taylor jabs a bat down in time
another yorker, and once again Taylor has to stab at it at the last moment
three in a row, excellent bowling, this time he squeezes to cover and gets a single
good shot here, finally Chigumbura lands a punch, driving over mid-off for four
not much timing here but enough for a single clubbed down the ground
ah lovely shot! That's more like it! Simple and effective clunk, perfectly straight down the ground
and that's not such a good one, stroking this gently to cover
Utseya is the new man and begins by steering to third man
driven off the back foot to cover
defended into the off side, no width to work with
good over that, ends with another careful defence
lifted into the midwicket region for a single
touch of extra bounce here, causes Utseya no end of trouble, getting a glove that loops just over de Villiers' running back
top shot this, Taylor gives himself a fraction of room and drives sweetly to the cover boundary
single this time, worked into the leg side. Can Taylor carry his bat!?
Utseya drives very firmly to Botha at mid-off
beautiful shot again! Parnell taking a pounding from Taylor who skips outside leg stump and eases a sweetly-timed drive over mid-off
steady stuff from Theron and Utseya picks up a single to give Taylor back the strike
false shot here but no harm done, Taylor aims a leg-side hack, comes off the outside edge over the keeper and third man fields
squeezed out to cover for another swift single
short ball, Utseya tried to hammer a pull shot but couldn't time it
this isn't timed ideally either, but enough bat to beat mid-off and run away for four
Utseya keeps the strike with a single
bang! Utseya has bludgeoned this, clearing his front leg and thwacking over midwicket
angled to point where some swift fielding prevents the single
wild swish outside off
short ball clattered to fine leg four four
Utseya flings himself off his feet as he tries to crash this through cover, but he misses
single pushed into space
steered very securely towards third man for a single
short ball outside off, Taylor tries to force it away but can't
bit fuller this time and Taylor drives again firmly down the ground
good ball, full and attacking the stumps but Taylor holds firm again
yorker length that Taylor full-faces down the wicket, he's almost reached the end now
Utseya just about squeezes this back down the ground
widish outside off, Utseya once again almost swings himself off his feet but misses
squeezed out point for a single to bring Taylor on strike
good work from Taylor, punching a single down the ground, what an effort this has been!
Utseya this time bunts the yorker to long-on for a single
steered very comfortably to point. One more!
that's it! South Africa win by 64 runs but Brendan Taylor, take a bow! He's become only the 9th person to ever bat through an innings, brave lone effort to end 145 not out off 136 balls
